title: 10 combine standouts that could make sense for Patriots to select in April’s NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Texas A&M WR KC Concepcion highlighted NFL Combine with strong performance in route running for potential Patriots draft pick.
Penn State's Dani Dennis-Sutton and UCF's Malachi Lawrence excelled in athletic drills; both are Day 2 draft targets for Patriots.
Arizona State OT Max Iheanachor had impressive 40-yard dash, solidifying his status as a potential Patriots first-round selectee.

title: Insider: Patriots probably won’t make a ‘Micah Parsons-type’ trade this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to trade major draft assets for star players this offseason, according to ESPN's Mike Reiss.
New England linked to Eagles' A.J. Brown and Raiders' Maxx Crosby, but asking prices remain high.
Coach Mike Vrabel stresses importance of building through the draft, with Patriots holding 11 picks in 2026.

title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power approved to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage system on former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
The facility will use lithium-ion batteries housed in 816 enclosures with two substations and underground transmission lines.
Construction is part of Everett's 'Docklands' project, a mixed-use development including lab, residential, and retail spaces.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'SNL' on Feb. 28, featuring Mumford & Sons as musical guest.
Storrie and 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams appeared in a skating sketch together.
U.S. Olympic hockey team members joined the monologue, making a light-hearted joke on national attention.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls at Sports Illustrated Stadium.
Revolution's Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana returned, helping manage the Red Bulls' strong first-half possession.
New England struggled against the Red Bulls' press, missing a key opportunity despite improved second-half momentum.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready for MLB Opening Day after tearing his patellar tendon last May.
Pitchers Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval have resumed pitching practice and aim to be ready for Opening Day.
Red Sox roster changes may limit roles for Casas, Crawford, and Sandoval despite their recovery progress.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to catch drivers who illegally pass buses.
The cameras activate with bus stop signs and capture violations for later citation, even without police presence.
The program, funded without taxpayer costs, follows pilot studies showing high rates of bus passing violations.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed to a sold-out crowd of 10,000 at Mohegan Sun Arena, emphasizing blues and rock elements.
Stapleton included stripped-down performances with only his guitar and highlighted tracks from his 2025 and earlier albums.
His band featured notable musicians like pedal steel player Paul Franklin and longtime bassist JT Cure.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save $16.8 million despite his strong performance and relationship with quarterback Drake Maye.
Christian Barmore faces uncertainty due to legal issues and could be traded if Patriots pursue top edge rusher Maxx Crosby.
Christian Elliss may be released to clear cap space, saving $6.25 million, while his 2025 performance was moderate.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play against the 76ers due to his ongoing recovery from Achilles injury.
Joel Embiid of the 76ers is sidelined with an oblique strain, missing Sunday's game and more.
The Celtics hold a slight edge with eight wins in their last ten, entering their final regular-season game against Philadelphia.
